CUSTOMISATION (SPHINX INDEX & CONFIGURATION)

CUSTOMISATION (SPHINX INDEX & CONFIGURATION)

A. index.rst file

  1. Locate index.rst file generated by sphinx-quickstart (source/index.rst)

  2. Edit top of file as desired. This text will be displayed on the welcome page of the website

    • Bold

    **text**

    • Italics

    *text*

    • Bullets

    * text

    • Separate main headings (====================)

    • Separate sub-headings (———————)

  3. Edit/add directives (.. directive::), e.g.:

    • Insert figure

    .. figure:: /images/sheffield-logo.jpg

    • Insert inline image

    .. |button_name| image:: /images/buttons/button_name.png

    • Include table of contents

    .. toctree::

    • Add a note box

    .. note:: This is a note box.

    • Add a warning box

    .. warning:: This is a warning box.

    • Add customised text box

    .. admonition:: Customised text box

  1. Customise directive features on new indented line directly underneath directive (:features:), e.g.:

    ..toctree::
        :maxdepth: 5
:caption: Contents:

    .. figure:: /images/sheffield-logo.jpg
        :align: right

  2. Display text on new indented line underneath directive with space separating lines, e.g.:

    .. admonition:: Customised text box

        This is a customised text box.

    .. figure:: /images/sheffield-logo.jpg
        :align: right

        University of Sheffield logo

B. conf.py file

  1. Locate conf.py file generated by sphinx-quickstart (source/conf.py)

  2. Add/adjust configuration options, e.g.:

    • Set theme to ReadTheDocs style:

      import sphinx_rtd_theme
html_theme = 'sphinx_rtd_theme'

    • Assign system path for locating project module directory

    sys.path.insert(0, os.path.abspath('../../src'))

    • Include extensions for sphinx autodocumentation generation (autodoc) and parsing of NumPy and Google style docstrings (napoleon):

      extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'sphinx.ext.napoleon']

    • Include extension for viewing code:

    extensions = ['sphinx.ext.viewcode']
    • Disable parsing of Google-style docstrings and alter how parameters and return types for functions are formatted (examples):

      napoleon_google_docstring = False napoleon_use_param = False napoleon_use_ivar = True
